summary_md: This round set a concrete plan to prove nontrivial lower bounds for 3-coloring cycles in the r-round quantum LOCAL model for r=2,3. Key technical claim: two-way r-round algorithms without initial shared entanglement satisfy an "independence beyond r" property (two-way analogue of LGR Lemma 3) via a symmetric-buffer Heisenberg-picture argument. The team will generalize LGR's line-segment LP (Sec. 4.2) to parameter r and search numerically for a segment length k with LP optimum q(r,k)<1, using S3 color and translation symmetries and smaller generating families of frame-collections to reduce size. If q<1 then (A) without entanglement independence + LGR Lemma 4 gives exponential-in-n decay; (B) with entanglement non-signaling gives a constant-error lower bound via a window-covering argument. Main obstacles: Akbari et al. (2024) barrier and LP growth with r,k. Concrete next steps: formalize the independence lemma, implement the r=2 LP for k≈10–16 and produce primal/dual certificates, then extend to r=3 as feasible. Verifier: success. Citations: prover-01.out.json; Le Gall–Rosmanis (2022); Akbari et al. (2024).
highlights: Proved (sketch) that two-way, no-shared-entanglement r-round quantum LOCAL algorithms have independence beyond r (two-way analogue of LGR Lemma 3) via symmetric buffers and reverse-evolved projectors.
Formulated an r-parameterized LP (generalizing LGR Sec.4.2) that upper-bounds success on a k-node line segment under non-signaling constraints; goal is to find k with optimum q(r,k)<1 for r=2,3.
Proposed effective symmetry reductions: quotient by S3 color-permutations and translation invariance on the segment; also restrict to small-t families of frame-collections to shrink LP.
If LP yields q<1 then: (no entanglement) independence + LGR Lemma 4 amplifies to exponential decay in n; (with entanglement) non-signaling plus window-covering gives a constant-error lower bound.
Recognized barriers: Akbari et al. (2024) prevents certain separations via non-signaling for general locality, but targeting fixed small r sidesteps that barrier.
Concrete computational plan: implement constraint generator and solve LP for r=2 (k≈10–16) and r=3 (smaller k), aiming for primal/dual certificates (e.g., q≤0.99) to certify bounds.
next_questions: Produce a formal, checkable write-up of the two-way independence-beyond-r lemma (Deliverable A) with explicit operator and support calculations.

Run the LP generator for r=2 (k in 10..16) with the proposed symmetry reductions; report the first k with LP optimum <1 and provide primal/dual certificates and robustness checks (varying the family F).
Formalize the window-covering argument for the shared-entanglement (non-signaling) case to derive an explicit constant error bound from any found q<1, and clarify limits on amplification.
